other_tests.findings: Fluid aspirated from the bursa showed 55,000 WBCs/mm3, predominantly lymphocytes. Culture of the fluid yielded S. schenckii.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Cultures from 3 bursal fluid aspirates were negative for fungi over the next 2 months. No clinical improvement was seen, necessitating subsequent surgical intervention.

other_tests.findings: Pathologic examination showed inflammation of the bursal synovium, but no organisms were seen on special stains. Fungus cultures of the tissue were negative.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, the patient developed a wound infection with Staphylococcus epidermidis, requiring incision and debridement. No further evidence of infection was detected, and the patient had full range of motion of the knee at 9 months after bursal excision.
